meanings.definition: A person who is very formal or serious
meanings.sent1: The stiffs at the meeting never cracked a smile.
meanings.sent2: The stiffs in suits looked out of place at the beach party.
meanings.sent3: Even the stiffs in the office loosened up at the holiday party.
meanings.sent4: The stiffs in the boardroom seemed to have forgotten how to laugh.
meanings.sent5: The stiffs in the courtroom made the atmosphere tense.

meanings.sent1: The con artist stiffs unsuspecting victims out of their money.
meanings.sent2: He stiffs his friends by never paying his share of the bill.
meanings.sent3: The magician playfully tried to stiff the audience with his disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: She felt cheated when he tried to stiff her out of her rightful prize.
meanings.sent5: The scammer's plan to stiff the elderly couple was foiled by the police.

meanings.definition: To make something rigid or stiff
meanings.sent1: She used starch to stiffen the collar of her shirt.
meanings.sent2: The cold weather stiffs the fabric of the tent, making it hard to fold.
meanings.sent3: The glue accidentally stiffened his fingers together.
meanings.sent4: The fear stiffened his body, making it hard to move.
meanings.sent5: The old book's pages had stiffened over time, making them difficult to turn.
